LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Title: Random Start
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.LaunchingWithoutConfiguri: You are launching {0} but you haven't configured it yet.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.SettingsAccess: (You can access the settings by right-clicking the Random button)
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.RespectMemberXenotypes: Only choose from player faction xenotypes
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Difficulty.Description: Choose the challenge level and game mode for your colony:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Difficulty.AnomalyDescrip: Configure anomaly-specific difficulty settings and threat levels:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Difficulty.CustomDescript: Fine-tune individual difficulty parameters to create your perfect challenge:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Difficulty.NoPauseChallen: When enabled, your colony will be unable to pause the game. This provides an intense challenge where time never stops flowing, requiring constant attention and quick decision-making.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Difficulty.HalfSpeedEnabl: When No Pause Challenge is active, this allows you to slow the game to half speed as your only respite from the relentless passage of time.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Scenarios.RandomizeScenar: When enabled, a random scenario will be selected from your enabled list. When disabled, you can choose which specific scenarios to include in the random pool.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Scenarios.Description: Choose which scenarios can be randomly selected for your colony:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Scenarios.ResearchDescrip: Customize your colony's starting research and technology level:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Scenarios.RemoveDefaultRe: Remove the research items that your colony would normally start with.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Scenarios.RandomizeResear: Randomly add research to your colony.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Scenarios.UnlockPrerequis: When unlocking a randomly assigned research, also unlock all other research topics that would normally be required to research it.\n\nFor example, when unlocking 'Battery' also unlock 'Electricity'.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Scenarios.ItemsDescriptio: Configure your colony's starting equipment and resources:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Scenarios.RemoveDefaultIt: Remove all scattered starting items that your scenario would normally provide. This includes weapons, food, medicine, and other resources scattered around your starting area.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Scenarios.RandomizeItemsT: Randomly add items to your starting area based on the configured count and tech level limits. These will replace any removed default items.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Scenarios.MarketValueLimi: Set a maximum total market value for all randomly generated starting items. This prevents overpowered starts by limiting the combined worth of random equipment and resources.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Storyteller.Title: Storyteller Selection
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Storyteller.Description: Choose which storytellers can be randomly selected to direct your colony's narrative:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Factions.RequiredDescript: These factions will always be present in the world:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Factions.RandomDescriptio: These factions may randomly appear in the world based on the count range:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Factions.UniqueFactionsTo: Only generate one of each type of faction.\n\nThis means that the maximum number of randomly generated factions will be the same as the amount of factions selected above.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Factions.RandomizeFaction: Randomly set your faction's relationship with generated factions.\n\nThis means that factions that are normally friendly to you may be hostile and factions that are normally hostile may be friendly.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Factions.ReputationExclus: These factions will keep their default relationships when reputation randomization is enabled:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.CoverageDescriptio: Determine how much of the planet is generated and explorable:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.MapSizeDescription: Set the size of maps for your colonies and encounters:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.GenerationDescript: Configure world generation parameters and environmental conditions:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.WorldGenDescriptio: Configure world generation parameters and environmental conditions:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.RandomiseWorldSeed: Randomly assign the seed used an the generation of your world.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.RandomizeRainfallT: Randomly set the planet's overall rainfall level, which affects biome distribution and how common wet vs dry areas are across the world.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.RandomizeTemperatu: Randomly set the planet's overall temperature level, which determines how common hot vs cold biomes are and affects the global climate patterns.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.RandomizePopulatio: Randomly set the planet's faction site density, which affects how many settlements, outposts, and faction bases are scattered across the world.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.RandomizePollution: Randomly set the starting pollution level across the planet. Higher pollution creates more wasteland areas and affects plant growth and animal health.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.RandomizeStartingS: Randomly choose which season your colony begins in. Different seasons affect temperature, plant growth, and available resources at game start.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.RandomizeRealistic: Enable randomization of Realistic Planets Continued mod settings, which affects planetary terrain generation and geographical features.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.AutoRealRuinsToolt: Automatically enable Real Ruins generation to populate the world with ruins from other players' colonies, adding variety and exploration opportunities.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Planet.RealRuinsBiomeFilt: Filter Real Ruins based on biome compatibility, ensuring ruins appear in appropriate environments that match their original settings.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.GenesDescription: Configure genetic traits and xenotypes for your starting colonists:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.RandomizeXenotypeToo: Randomly assign xenotypes to your starting pawns from all available xenotype definitions. This affects their genetic traits, abilities, and appearance.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.RespectFactionXenoty: When randomizing xenotypes, only choose from xenotypes that are appropriate for your faction's members. This maintains lore consistency for faction-specific genetic traits.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.RandomizeCustomGenes: Instead of using predefined xenotypes, randomly assign individual genes to create custom genetic combinations for your starting pawns.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.MinimumMetabolicEffi: Set a minimum metabolic efficiency requirement when generating random genes. This prevents creating pawns with extremely poor metabolism that would require excessive food consumption.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.IdeologyDescription: Customize ideology generation and belief systems for your colony:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.PlayClassicModeToolt: Disable the ideology system and use classic faction relationships instead. This removes ideological mechanics like beliefs, rituals, and precepts from the game.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.ForcedMemesDescripti: These memes will always be included in your colony's ideology:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.DisallowedMemesDescr: These memes will never be included in randomly generated ideologies:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.DisallowedPreceptsDe: These specific precepts will be excluded from ideology generation:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.LoadExistingIdeology: Use a previously saved custom ideology file (.rid) instead of generating a new random ideology. This allows you to reuse ideologies from other colonies or campaigns.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.StartingColonistsDes: Configure special requirements for your starting colonists:
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.Misc.StartingPawnsMustBeC: Do not generate starting pawns that are incapable of violence due to medical issues, backgrounds or traits.
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.StartingTile.Title: Starting Tile
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.StartingTile.FilterStarti: Enable to filter which biomes are allowed for starting tiles
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.StartingTile.NoBiomesSele: No biomes selected (will use default behavior)
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.StartingTile.FilterStarti: Enable to filter which hilliness types are allowed for starting tiles
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.StartingTile.NoHillinessS: No hilliness selected (will use default behavior)
LanguageData.RandomStartMod.TooltipTitles.StartingPaw: Starting Pawns Must be Capable of Violence
